channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A type of mortgage that was popular during the subprime crisis is making a comeback. This time it’s not a warning sign.
item.description: Home buyers are turning to interest-free second mortgages to fund their down payments.

item.title: A Mystery $30 Million Wave of Pro-Trump Bets Has Moved a Popular Prediction Market
item.description: Four Polymarket accounts have systematically placed frequent bets on a Trump election victory.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Falls 0.3% To 98.10
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index fell 0.3% to 98.10 — snapping a five-trading-day winning streak.

item.title: Trump tariffs would hit these stock-market sectors the hardest
item.description: S&P 500 could see a 4.7% decline next year, according to a Barclays analysis.

item.title: Visa Wanted a Vast Empire. First, It Had to Beat Back Its Foes.
item.description: By wooing partners and strong-arming competitors, Visa sits atop the payments world and in the sights of the Justice Department

item.title: U.S. Stocks End Higher, Led by Netflix Rally
item.description: U.S. stocks rose as technology lifted the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite. The Dow industrials rose modestly into fresh record territory.

item.title: The Score: Netflix, Morgan Stanley, TSMC and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: These 3 struggles sent this retired couple back to the U.S. after a move overseas
item.description: Moving to Portugal in retirement was a dream — but they weren’t ready for the reality.

item.title: These 6 charts suggest investors should proceed with caution as S&P 500 hits 47th record high of 2024
item.description: Some say investors are growing too complacent as the bull market shows no signs of slowing down.

item.title: The real-estate industry is battling over how homes are listed for sale. Here’s why that matters to buyers and sellers.
item.description: The outcome of the battle could change how the average American finds for-sale home listings.
